comments.body: This is truly needed ! Why are they walls if they don't connect with doors
Yeah I don't understand why doors don't connect to walls that doesn't make any sense. In any home doors connect to walls.

I was going to post the same! Maybe if wall placement worked like door placement, that is, that walls are not placed in the center of the block but in one of the borders, doors would be compatible with walls.
This would be amazing! If they did this, you could use walls as house walls instead of just fortresses.
Absolutely must need... if my furnace and crafting table can attach to a wall, surely a door should be able to
YESSS PLEASE MAKE THIS HAPPEN
The aesthetics of my new base are so shot without this. The lack of compatible doors just make walls so much less useful!
Please let us connect Doors to walls. It works with gates so I know it's possible!
I find this frustrating! Looks very tacky. Hope they will add soon.
Yes please!
I think that’s an awesome idea! I’ve always wanted to cook food on campfires!
Can’t you just cook the raw food in it then just leave it when it’s done cooking

Is there really three types of air in Minecraft, is it just a lighting effect or animation? I haven't seen any mechanic for this in the game as in the set block command it only has air not any other types, I play PE so it might be different but I don't know. The idea is cool but, i think it would require creating a complicated are mechanic which Minecraft doesn't have.

Ok well if there is already a coding in game that works with the holgins and piglins, why change it? Another thing you failed to consider is that air is unobtainable in all gamemodes, even with commands. Why would you want to add something to the game that you can't ever get? Besides if you want piglins and hoglins in the overworld, there is a command that can do that. That is also too complicated of a concept. Minecraft is meant to be simple. And I can't count for the different air blocks, but even if that is the case it is because they have different property to them. Air is normal classic air, cave air lets the game know when to play cave sounds, and void air kills you.
Genious. We need this.
I didnt know there were different types of air!

People have always questioned the existence of ghostly or similar supernatural entities that live in the world of minecraft because there is skeletons and zombies. This would probably be the best we'd get since actual ghosts would offend players who are religious and frightened easily. This fits within minecraft too, it'd be cool to have another minion like a golem.
I would love to see it as an actual block with it's design
Maybe a golem made using one of these would be hostile to you

Personally I'd rather just have it as a decorative block. Adding a soulfire torch to a carved pumpkin to make a soulfire Jack o'lantern seem really obvious (until you realise it's not currently an option)

If it had any additional functionality (besides being a lower light level) I think that should emphasise the eerie and imposing nature of the block. Additionally it would be a neat extra layer to the "mobs wear pumpkins on halloween" easter-egg currently hidden in the game.

The idea sounds good. But maybe it would be better if the mob kept the soul pumpkin on it, or for it to fall out of the process and the mob's eyes shine with the blue light of the souls inside. This mob would be faster and stronger and would certainly have a better drop. For example, from obsessed wither skeletons, there would be a better chance of dropping the skull (so you have a reason to do something like that at all). After you kill the obsessed mob, a cloud of souls would appear around it, which would melt away after a while.

I think it would be a bit too OP.

But if we removed the ability to floating through walls and invisibility + made it so effect ends when either your body or "the ghost get hit. I think it would be a really cool addition to the game.

I agree with the previous statement and I think that when you are in that form you should have to male it back to the body before the potion runs out else you and your body will die because your soul is separated from your body.
Je trouve que cela pourrait être une idée amusante, mais il faudrait une courte durée de potions. L'idée que notre "corp" reste n'est pas mal non plus !

So long as your body is safe you're fine? Kinda OP since you can block yourself in somewhere. Add Soul Stalkers, mobs that only spawn when you Soul Walk. They'll act as Boo from Mario, only moving and attacking when your back is turned. And Soul Mites, mobs that have a chance of spawning in groups of 5 and higher whenever you drink the potion. When your Soul Hearts go down, you return to your body
A soul fire blaze would be cool, but maybe regular souls should drop the soul powder, or both.

My deleted post about Soul Blazes:

Soul Blazes are a variation of the classical blaze, that instead of throwing normal fire charges they throw soul fire charges that deal more damage, making them tougher. 

They could have another features such as:

  • Higher health (30 points)
  • Can detect you from higher distances 
  • Smaller hitbox so they can pass through small gaps like ghosts. 
  • Snowballs deal them more damage than to classic Blazes.

About drops: They drop soul blaze rods, which can be used to power brewing stands. Making soul blaze powder you can use it to make ender eyes as well. You can use it for a potion effect too (this post). 

They could spawn in soulsand valleys or in a separate spawner in fortresses.
Ok I love the idea but it has to be harder to get it is way too op
Maybe introduce some new plants with that effect.
perhaps have other flowers do the opposite - open during the night and close in the day
Now in game flowers are like paper maked. Always bloomed. It will surely gives a realism.
lemons grow on trees
Probably lemons make you jump when eaten because they're sour?

Lemonade should also be added. It could be crafted using a lemon, a water bottle, and sugar. It would look like this on a crafting table:

empty/empty/empty

lemon/waterbottle/sugar

empty/empty/empty
YES I LIKEIT

I know that there is netherite armor, but what if we just changed the textures on the existing armor. The armor is very uniform right now and I would like to see that each set of armor has a unique design for the texture. For example, the iron armor could have visible interlocking plates. Just an idea.

Bronce: Se elaborará con cobre y estaño (Caserita). La caserita y el carbón se encontrarían en la capa 73 y el cobre en la capa 64, eliminando y haciendo del hierro un mineral más difícil de obtener. Luego fundimos la Caserita para crear estaño, usamos la mesa de producción, unimos cobre con estaño y hacemos bronce, y luego hacemos una mesa de herrería con bronce, tendremos dos opciones, hacer una armadura de bronce o usar la mesa de herrero para une la armadura de bronce y cuero y forma otro tipo de armadura que cubriría 4 puntos y 1 para reforjar, que es básicamente una mejora que va encima de un punto de armadura ya ocupado y vale medio punto.

 

Oro y hierro: el oro se encuentra en la capa 32 y se puede picar con un pico de bronce. El hierro se deshilacha con un pico de bronce, se encontrará en la capa 25, la función de reforja se puede usar usando oro como una mejora que cubrirá 6 1/2 puntos más 2 Reforges. La armadura de hierro normal cubrirá 6 y la armadura dorada 5.

 

Acero: Se encontrará en la capa 17, habrá que picarlo con un pico de hierro y para fundirlo necesitará carbón, servirá de mejora para el diamante pero también se puede hacer una armadura solo de este material el cual cubrirá 7 puntos.

 

Diamante: Se encontrará en la capa 11, se puede picar con un pico de acero, la armadura normal cubrirá 8 puntos, pero la mejorada con acero cubrirá 9 puntos más 3 refuerzos. Aunque la actualización solo se puede hacer con una mesa de herrería hecha de hierro.

I think we need to see copper armor be in the mix. I would also like to be able to change all types of armor different colors, including enchanted armor to give one more variety on the look of a character. I would also like to see skins replace the look of armor you are wearing so you can show off that look while being protected.
What if the devs created a new end set of armor and each piece needed a piece of netherite armor 3 obsidian 2 diamonds and 1 eye of ender
I think it would be cool if the different combinations gave different cool effects!
I think it shouldn't give any armor points as it doesn't really protect any part of you but other than that I like this idea. It sounds super cute.
yasssss- this sounds so cute, imagine having a flower crown on you fox or bee

And it shouldn't take up amour slots

Thia is such a cool idea I LOVE it

 

Maybe also because its a flower update idea, they could add MORE COLOURS
i know im a bit late but it would be really cool if bees followed youand could pollinate off you and didn't attack you if you were wearing one of these
They should do the same with berries.
I was low key about to say they should add something like this too.

Honey cake is good.
But... milk si okay, honey = sugar.

Yes so we can have differnt cake so borning wirh just one cake

Gold is a weak metal so the anvil would have very low durabillity. If anything getting high enchantments using it should be a gamble for instance I want Sharpness V on my sword and there is a 30% chance that the book won't bond to my sword. So in other words each high end book used on the gold anvil to enchant gear has a persentage saying what the chances of the enchantment book working.
Oh yeah! I forgot to add that. 12 uses for the anvil.

This might be a little overpowered, but here's how I see it:

Enchantments and repairing aren't limited, meaning you will never see the "too expensive" message appear underneath. To balance this out though, enchantments would be very expansive, maybe costing hundreds of levels, something worth the effort for some people.

I also imagine the anvil, being gold, would have to have some sort of a power or sacrifice system put into it. Similar to how enchantment tables benefit from bookshelves, maybe golden blocks could surround the anvil, and increase its power.
There should be a enchanted apple in the recipe to balance it.

I like the idea of going beyond 40 levels, but not increasing max enchantment level to 7. Additionally there should be a 100% chance to damage the gold anvil each use as it's a powerful mechanic and gold is a weak material
maby it has a high chanse of getting damaged
I like how this request is simple but can greatly improve the game!
Explosives can't go off underwater.
They can they just won't do damage.
The game have the bubbles that are on lava, they can just change color and physics
Good idea. Also, make the bubbles carry entities to the surface.

Voted and followed. This definitely seems like something that should be in the game for purely practical reasons.

Everyone who sees this post and has Facebook and/or Twitter should share this post to try and get it more votes.

I like the idea, it would be great for building.

I like this. It would be purely for aesthetics but it’d be really good for campsites, forest fires, nether portals or burned towns.

I’d add that other burnt blocks could be good, a chance of wood turning into charred wood, for both planks and logs. The logs could be a source of charcoal if they balanced it right, like only the bottom stump becomes charcoal so it can’t be farmed easily.
Additionally, by applying the same concept to saplings, dead bushes could be produced renewably. I'm all for this idea

Because you need to promote forest protection, and you can’t grow stuff on burnt grass, at least not for a while,so that you don’t burn down forests for no reason in Minecraft.

On the other hand, Canada did forest fire protection so well that the pine beetles are helping the fire kill trees.
I would prefer the name "Scorched Dirt"
I like your idea, and I think that there should be more enchantments for the trident.

Tridents shouldn't be craftable (Upgrade or no upgrade). How merging it with something in an anvil instead?
Glowing mushrooms would be cool.
I really like the idea of glowing mushrooms in caves. Maybe you could make a special kind of torch with it that attracts hostile mobs!

they should have some mushrooms that look similar to these new mushrooms, but they give a negative effect when consuming them. for example, there could be a mushroom found in caves that is blue with white dots and one with black dots. the one with white dots could give you night vision, and the one with black dots could give you blindness. it would make the game a lot more interesting if you had to watch what you eat. this would be like poison potatoes but you might actually eat them on accident.
